title: The military commander Avitus is proclaimed Emperor of the Western Roman Empire.
text: • 455 – The military commander Avitus is proclaimed Emperor of the Western Roman Empire.

title: Odoacer makes a night assault with his Heruli guardsmen, engaging Theoderic the Great in Ad Pinetam. Both sides suffer heavy losses, but in the end Theodoric forces Odoacer back into Ravenna.
text: • 491 – Odoacer makes a night assault with his Heruli guardsmen, engaging Theoderic the Great in Ad Pinetam. Both sides suffer heavy losses, but in the end Theodoric forces Odoacer back into Ravenna.

title: Korean forces under general Kim Yu
text: • 660 – Korean forces under general Kim Yu-sin of Silla defeat the army of Baekje in the Battle of Hwangsanbeol.

title: The 8.4
text: • 869 – The 8.4–9.0 Mw Sanriku earthquake strikes the area around Sendai in northern Honshu, Japan. Inundation from the tsunami extended several kilometers inland.

title: Emperor Charles IV assists in laying the foundation stone of Charles Bridge in Prague.
text: • 1357 – Emperor Charles IV assists in laying the foundation stone of Charles Bridge in Prague.

title: The Old Swiss Confederacy makes great strides in establishing control over its territory by soundly defeating the Archduchy of Austria in the Battle of Sempach.
text: • 1386 – The Old Swiss Confederacy makes great strides in establishing control over its territory by soundly defeating the Archduchy of Austria in the Battle of Sempach.

title: Turko
text: • 1401 – Turko-Mongol ruler Tamerlane (Timur) destroys Baghdad, killing 20,000.

title: King Henry VIII of England annuls his marriage to his fourth wife, Anne of Cleves.
text: • 1540 – King Henry VIII of England annuls his marriage to his fourth wife, Anne of Cleves.

title: Nineteen Catholics suffer martyrdom for their beliefs in the Dutch town of Gorkum.
text: • 1572 – Nineteen Catholics suffer martyrdom for their beliefs in the Dutch town of Gorkum.

title: Bohemia is granted freedom of religion through the Letter of Majesty by the Holy Roman Emperor, Rudolf II.
text: • 1609 – Bohemia is granted freedom of religion through the Letter of Majesty by the Holy Roman Emperor, Rudolf II.

title: A Bourbon force under Nicolas Catinat withdraws from a smaller Habsburg force under Prince Eugene of Savoy in the Battle of Carpi.
text: • 1701 – A Bourbon force under Nicolas Catinat withdraws from a smaller Habsburg force under Prince Eugene of Savoy in the Battle of Carpi.

title: French victory in the Battle of Melle allows them to capture Ghent in the days after.
text: • 1745 – French victory in the Battle of Melle allows them to capture Ghent in the days after.

title: The Braddock Expedition is soundly defeated by a smaller French and Native American force in its attempt to capture Fort Duquesne in what is now downtown Pittsburgh.
text: • 1755 – The Braddock Expedition is soundly defeated by a smaller French and Native American force in its attempt to capture Fort Duquesne in what is now downtown Pittsburgh.

title: George Washington orders the Declaration of Independence to be read out to members of the Continental Army in Manhattan, while thousands of British troops on Staten Island prepare for the Battle of Long Island.
text: • 1776 – George Washington orders the Declaration of Independence to be read out to members of the Continental Army in Manhattan, while thousands of British troops on Staten Island prepare for the Battle of Long Island.

title: In Versailles, the National Assembly reconstitutes itself as the National Constituent Assembly and begins preparations for a French constitution.
text: • 1789 – In Versailles, the National Assembly reconstitutes itself as the National Constituent Assembly and begins preparations for a French constitution.

title: The Swedish Navy captures one third of the Russian Baltic fleet.
text: • 1790 – The Swedish Navy captures one third of the Russian Baltic fleet.

title: The Act Against Slavery in Upper Canada bans the importation of slaves and will free those who are born into slavery after the passage of the Act at 25 years of age.
text: • 1793 – The Act Against Slavery in Upper Canada bans the importation of slaves and will free those who are born into slavery after the passage of the Act at 25 years of age.

title: The Treaties of Tilsit are signed by Napoleon I of France and Alexander I of Russia.
text: • 1807 – The Treaties of Tilsit are signed by Napoleon I of France and Alexander I of Russia.

title: Napoleon annexes the Kingdom of Holland as part of the First French Empire.
text: • 1810 – Napoleon annexes the Kingdom of Holland as part of the First French Empire.

title: Explorer David Thompson posts a sign near what is now Sacajawea State Park in Washington state, claiming the Columbia District for the United Kingdom.
text: • 1811 – Explorer David Thompson posts a sign near what is now Sacajawea State Park in Washington state, claiming the Columbia District for the United Kingdom.

title: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand
text: • 1815 – Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord becomes the first Prime Minister of France.

title: Argentina declares independence from Spain.
text: • 1816 – Argentina declares independence from Spain.

title: Four hundred and seventy prominent Cypriots including Archbishop Kyprianos are executed in response to Cypriot aid to the Greek War of Independence
text: • 1821 – Four hundred and seventy prominent Cypriots including Archbishop Kyprianos are executed in response to Cypriot aid to the Greek War of Independence

title: U.S. President Zachary Taylor dies after eating raw fruit and iced milk, he is succeeded in office by Vice President Millard Fillmore.
text: • 1850 – U.S. President Zachary Taylor dies after eating raw fruit and iced milk, he is succeeded in office by Vice President Millard Fillmore.

title: Persian prophet Báb is executed in Tabriz, Persia.
text: • 1850 – Persian prophet Báb is executed in Tabriz, Persia.

title: The Siege of Port Hudson ends, giving the Union complete control of the Mississippi River.
text: • 1863 – The Siege of Port Hudson ends, giving the Union complete control of the Mississippi River.

title: The 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, guaranteeing African Americans full citizenship and all persons in the United States due process of law.
text: • 1868 – The 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, guaranteeing African Americans full citizenship and all persons in the United States due process of law.

title: The Herzegovina Uprising against Ottoman rule begins, which would last until 1878 and have far
text: • 1875 – The Herzegovina Uprising against Ottoman rule begins, which would last until 1878 and have far-reaching implications throughout the Balkans.

title: The inaugural Wimbledon Championships begins.
text: • 1877 – The inaugural Wimbledon Championships begins.

title: Daniel Hale Williams, American heart surgeon, performs 1st successful open
text: • 1893 – Daniel Hale Williams, American heart surgeon, performs 1st successful open-heart surgery in United States without anesthesia.

title: William Jennings Bryan delivers his Cross of Gold speech advocating bimetallism at the 1896 Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
text: • 1896 – William Jennings Bryan delivers his Cross of Gold speech advocating bimetallism at the 1896 Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

title: The Federation of Australia is given royal assent.
text: • 1900 – The Federation of Australia is given royal assent.

title: The Governor of Shanxi province in North China orders the execution of 45 foreign Christian missionaries and local church members, including children.
text: • 1900 – The Governor of Shanxi province in North China orders the execution of 45 foreign Christian missionaries and local church members, including children.

title: In Nashville, Tennessee, an inbound local train collides with an outbound express, killing 101 and injuring 171 people, making it the deadliest rail accident in United States history.
text: • 1918 – In Nashville, Tennessee, an inbound local train collides with an outbound express, killing 101 and injuring 171 people, making it the deadliest rail accident in United States history.

title: Johnny Weissmuller swims the 100 meters freestyle in 58.6 seconds breaking the world swimming record and the 'minute barrier'.
text: • 1922 – Johnny Weissmuller swims the 100 meters freestyle in 58.6 seconds breaking the world swimming record and the 'minute barrier'.

title: The state of São Paulo revolts against the Brazilian Federal Government, starting the Constitutionalist Revolution.
text: • 1932 – The state of São Paulo revolts against the Brazilian Federal Government, starting the Constitutionalist Revolution.

title: The silent film archives of Fox Film Corporation are destroyed by the 1937 Fox vault fire.
text: • 1937 – The silent film archives of Fox Film Corporation are destroyed by the 1937 Fox vault fire.

title: World War II: The Allied invasion of Sicily soon causes the downfall of Mussolini and forces Hitler to break off the Battle of Kursk.
text: • 1943 – World War II: The Allied invasion of Sicily soon causes the downfall of Mussolini and forces Hitler to break off the Battle of Kursk.

title: World War II: American forces take Saipan, bringing the Japanese archipelago within range of B
text: • 1944 – World War II: American forces take Saipan, bringing the Japanese archipelago within range of B-29 raids, and causing the downfall of the Tojo government.

title: World War II: Continuation War: Finland wins the Battle of Tali
text: • 1944 – World War II: Continuation War: Finland wins the Battle of Tali-Ihantala, the largest battle ever fought in northern Europe. The Red Army withdraws its troops from Ihantala and digs into a defensive position, thus ending the Vyborg–Petrozavodsk Offensive.

title: The Russell
text: • 1955 – The Russell–Einstein Manifesto calls for a reduction of the risk of nuclear warfare.

title: The 7.7 Mw Amorgos earthquake shakes the Cyclades island group in the Agean Sea with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). The shaking and the destructive tsunami that followed left fifty
text: • 1956 – The 7.7 Mw Amorgos earthquake shakes the Cyclades island group in the Agean Sea with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). The shaking and the destructive tsunami that followed left fifty-three people dead. A damaging M7.2 aftershock occurred minutes after the mainshock.

title: A 7.8 Mw strike
text: • 1958 – A 7.8 Mw strike-slip earthquake in Alaska causes a landslide that produces a megatsunami. The runup from the waves reached 525 m (1,722 ft) on the rim of Lituya Bay; five people were killed.

title: Starfish Prime tests the effects of a nuclear test at orbital altitudes.
text: • 1962 – Starfish Prime tests the effects of a nuclear test at orbital altitudes.

title: A car bomb destroys a Renault motor car owned by "Nazi hunters" Serge and Beate Klarsfeld outside their home in France in an unsuccessful assassination attempt.
text: • 1979 – A car bomb destroys a Renault motor car owned by "Nazi hunters" Serge and Beate Klarsfeld outside their home in France in an unsuccessful assassination attempt.

title: Pan Am Flight 759 crashes in Kenner, Louisiana, killing all 145 people on board and eight others on the ground.
text: • 1982 – Pan Am Flight 759 crashes in Kenner, Louisiana, killing all 145 people on board and eight others on the ground.

title: The New Zealand Parliament passes the Homosexual Law Reform Act legalising homosexuality in New Zealand.
text: • 1986 – The New Zealand Parliament passes the Homosexual Law Reform Act legalising homosexuality in New Zealand.

title: The Parliament of Canada passes the Nunavut Act leading to the 1999 creation of Nunavut, dividing the Northwest Territories into arctic (Inuit) and sub
text: • 1993 – The Parliament of Canada passes the Nunavut Act leading to the 1999 creation of Nunavut, dividing the Northwest Territories into arctic (Inuit) and sub-arctic (Dene) lands based on a plebiscite.

title: The Navaly church bombing is carried out by the Sri Lanka Air Force killing 125 Tamil civilian refugees.
text: • 1995 – The Navaly church bombing is carried out by the Sri Lanka Air Force killing 125 Tamil civilian refugees.

title: Days of student protests begin after Iranian police and hardliners attack a student dormitory at the University of Tehran.
text: • 1999 – Days of student protests begin after Iranian police and hardliners attack a student dormitory at the University of Tehran.

title: The African Union is established in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, replacing the Organisation of African Unity (OAU). The organization's first chairman is Thabo Mbeki, President of South Africa.
text: • 2002 – The African Union is established in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, replacing the Organisation of African Unity (OAU). The organization's first chairman is Thabo Mbeki, President of South Africa.

title: One hundred twenty
text: • 2006 – One hundred twenty-five people are killed when S7 Airlines Flight 778, a Airbus A310 passenger jet, veers off the runway while landing in wet conditions at Irkutsk Airport in Siberia.

title: South Sudan gains independence and secedes from Sudan.
text: • 2011 – South Sudan gains independence and secedes from Sudan.
